newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary to sell min 68.15 pct of steelworks - APV.
newsitem.headline: Hungary to sell min 68.15 pct of steelworks - APV.

text.p: Hungarian privatisation agency APV Rt will open a private tender to sell a minimum 68.15 percent stake in the Diosgyor steelworks in northeast Hungary, APV said.
APV spokeswoman Eva Bognar said on Friday that the tender offer would be published in late May or early June in domestic and international publications.
The strategic partner would be asked in addition to inject a minimum of four billion forints new capital into the steelworks, which is one of Hungary's biggest, APV said.
Diosgyor posted an operating loss of 5.5 billion forints on net sales of 20.9 billion forints last year.
Following the close of the tender, APV will make available 10 percent of registered capital to employees at preferential rates.
The company in Hungary's economically depressed northeast produces rolled steel and steel ingots.
Its high operating loss last year was in part attributed to renovation of its electric furnace.
